title: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't trigger a 'Find' operation on Mac OS X
description: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X.
EB: Eclipse 3.0 M2Build id: 200307181617, Mac OS X 10.2.6
SR:
1) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit -> Find/Replace).
2) Type a search term into the text box.
3) Press the Enter/Return key.
Expected Behavior: The Enter/Return key should trigger a 'Find' operation, similar to clicking on the 'Find' button, which is highlighted as the default button in the Find/Replace dialog.
